com.wm.xmldata

Class XmlDataSubstitutionTag

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.wm.xmldata.XmlDataTag
      • com.wm.xmldata.XmlDataContentTag
        • com.wm.xmldata.XmlDataSubstitutionTag
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Cloneable

    public class XmlDataSubstitutionTag
extends XmlDataContentTag
    The XmlDataSubstitutionTag class constructs an XmlData substitution-tag from its constituent parts. There are methods that return the full-name as well as the path-name. The full-name is used in XmlData infosets. The path-name is used in map-paths and copy-paths; they contains additional qualifying information. In an XmlData infoset, substitution-tags are always paired with substitution-items and the pair is contained in a group-value.

    The substitution-tag full-name format is 

         {particle-id}*substitution-ncName#namespace
    where the particle-id identifies the position of this substitution-tag relative to all substitution-tags of the same name in a content model, ncName and namespace identify the head of the substitution group. For example, a schema model group might employ a substitution group head of the same name in the first and fourth position, with other elements in the second and third positions. 
         {1}*substitution-able#smaple.org    signifies the first occurrence and
     {2}*substitution-able#sample.org    signifies the fourth occurrence.

    The substitution-tag path-name provides additional path properties and has format: 

         {particle-id}*substitution-ncName#namespace[index]{indirect-qualifier}
    It includes additional properties: index specifies an offset into an array of repeating substitution-items and indirect-qualifier specifies the value-tag for indirect-items.

    For example, a substitution-tag that references the 2nd occurrence of a particle and the 3rd repeating value and specifies the value-tag for the substitution-item has path-name: 

         {2}*substitution-able#sample.org[2]{baker#sample.org}

        Parameters:
        ncName - the ncName of the schema substitutionGroup head
        namespace - the XML namespace of the schema substitutionGroup head
        particleId - the particle-id of the tag
        index - the index of the repeating item assigned to the tag

        namespace - the namespace
        particleId - the particle id

      • createFromPath

        public static XmlDataSubstitutionTag createFromPath(java.lang.String name,
                                                    XmlNamespaceMap nsDecls)
        Create an XmlDataSubstitutionTag from its String representation. This form uses namespace prefix notation when creating the tag. Its form is {particleId}*substitution-prefix:ncName[index][qualifier}
        where:
        • particleId -- the particle-id
        • prefix -- the he prefix; it must be defined by the XmlNamespace map argument
        • nncName -- the local name portion of the tag
        • index -- the tag value index (starting at 0 or a symbolic iterator
        • qualifier -- is the indirect-item's value tag
        The : is omitted when there is no namespace. If particleId is omitted, it defaults to {1}. The index and qualifier never appear in the instance tag; they are used only in the tag to provide addition information to methods. This form of the constructor may be used with any namespace characters. The namespace is assigned to a prefix by the nsDecla argument. If particleId is omitted, it defaults to {1}. There is no default for index or qualifier; when not specified, such tags are unindexed and unqualified. Examples: 
         {3}*substitution-product
 *substitution-ns:location{!type}
 {3}*substitution-status[xx]{information#example.org}
        Parameters:
        name - the full String representation of the tag
        nsDecls - an XmlNamespaceMap specifying prefix definitions
        Returns:
        the XmlDataSubstitutionTag created from its String representation

      • createFromPath

        public static XmlDataSubstitutionTag createFromPath(java.lang.String name)
        Create an XmlDataSubstitutionTag from its String representation. Its form is {particleId}*substitution-ncName#namespace[index][indirectQualifier}
        where:
        • particleId -- the particle-id
        • ncName -- the XML local name
        • namespace -- the XML namespace
        • index -- the tag value index (starting at 0 or a symbolic iterator
        • indirectQualifier -- is the indirect-item's value tag
        The # is omitted when there is no namespace. If particleId is omitted, it defaults to {1}. The index and qualifier never appear in the instance tag; they are used only in the tag to provide additional information to methods. This form of the constructor may not be used if the namespace contains the index bracket '[' or ']' or the path separator '/' unless they are expressed as % escapes. Use %2F for /, %5B for [, %5D for ], and %25 for %. Otherwise, the explicit constructor must be used, or use createFromPath(String, XmlNamespaceMap) to specify the namespace using prefix notation. The # is omitted when there is no namespace. If particleId is omitted, it defaults to {1}. There is no default for index or qualifier; when not specified, such tags are unindexed and unqualified. Examples: 
         {3}*substitution-product
 *substitution-location#example.org{!type}
 {3}*substitution-status[xx]{information#example.org}
        Parameters:
        name - the full String representation of the tag
        Returns:
        the XmlDataSubstitutionTag created from its String representation
        See Also:
        createFromPath(String, XmlNamespaceMap), createFromPath(String, String)

      • createFromPath

        public static XmlDataSubstitutionTag createFromPath(java.lang.String name,
                                                    java.lang.String nsPairs)
        Create a XmlData substitution-tag using prefix notation. The method operates identically to createFromPath(String, XmlNamespaceMap) but the namespace map is specified as a String containing prefix/namespace pairs.
        Parameters:
        name - the String form of the tag using prefix notation
        nsPairs - the namespace map expressed as space-delimited prefix/namespace pairs.
        Returns:
        the constructed substitution-tag

      • getPathName

        public java.lang.String getPathName()
        Returns substitution-tag the tag in path-name format. If the XML namespace includes the '[', ']', '/', or '%' character, the namespace is %-escaped. The path-name includes the particle-id, ncName, namespace, index, and indirect-qualifier. The full-name, index, and indirect-qualifier may be iterator-tags.
        Overrides:
        getPathName in class XmlDataContentTag
        Returns:
        String form of hr substitution-tag

        Parameters:
